page.title: 08FARMING PAISLEY
page.content: {Blackbyres Farm}is run very much on the same lines as Harelaw.It takes up 150 acres. Instead of silage making Blackbyres grows turnips to supplement the animals' food. They also keep sheep but these are grazed in a rented field in Newton Mearns on the south side of Glasgow. The farmer has had experience of sheep worrying and has been forced to use his gun on two dogs which savaged lambs and later came back for more. Once a dog has tasted blood it will return. Both this farm and Harelaw Farm, described on Pages 6&7 are self-sufficient and milk producing.
